tool_description: Controls camera settings and captures high-resolution images of museum objects with embedded technical metadata for archival documentation.

accession_number.description: Unique identifier of object being photographed

view_type.description: Type of view being captured: overall_front, overall_back, detail, signature, inscription, damage, other

aperture.description: Lens aperture setting (e.g., f/8, f/11, f/16)

resolution_dpi.description: Target resolution in dots per inch (300-600)

color_profile.description: Color space profile: sRGB, AdobeRGB, ProPhotoRGB

photographer_name.description: Name of person taking the photograph

error_messages: Object not found: Accession number does not exist in collection database
Invalid view type: Must be one of [overall_front, overall_back, detail, signature, inscription, damage, other]
ISO out of range: Must be between 50-6400
Invalid aperture format: Use format like f/8, f/11, f/16
Invalid shutter speed format: Use format like 1/60, 1/125, 2s
Resolution out of range: DPI must be between 300-600
Invalid color profile: Must be one of [sRGB, AdobeRGB, ProPhotoRGB]
Camera not ready: Check camera connection and battery level
Insufficient storage space: Clear storage or change memory card
usage: Configure camera settings based on object requirements and lighting conditions. Ensure proper focus and composition before capturing. Multiple views may be needed for complete documentation.

image_filename.description: Generated filename for the captured image

file_size_mb.description: Size of captured image file in megabytes

technical_metadata.description: Embedded EXIF and technical capture data
